alert.note: Alert for Delaware Beaches; Inland Sussex; Kent (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 8:56AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Sussex and southeastern Kent Counties through 930 AM EDT... At 856 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Big Stone Beach to near Georgetown to Parsonsburg. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Milford, Millsboro, Lewes, Milton, Selbyville, Dagsboro, Millville, Bowers, Henlopen Acres, Gumboro, Cape Henlopen State Park, Big Stone Beach, Long Neck, Ocean View, Frankford, South Bethany and Dewey Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
